author: ikkysleepy
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```
 Get-CimInstance -ClassName Win32_Process
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
```
ProcessId Name                                 HandleCount WorkingSetSize VirtualSize
--------- ----                                 ----------- -------------- -----------
0         System Idle Process                  0           8192           65536
4         System                               7680        4902912        13611008
460       smss.exe                             52          323584         2199063539712
648       csrss.exe                            970         2146304        2199121633280
744       wininit.exe                          146         1245184        2199111450624
832       services.exe                         936         9850880        2199125368832
840       lsass.exe                            5113        21426176       2199179808768
996       svchost.exe                          77          819200         2199081472000
...

```

Actual behavior
---------------

```
PS /home/ubuntu>  Get-CimInstance -ClassName Win32_Process
Get-CimInstance : The term 'Get-CimInstance' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:2
+  Get-CimInstance -ClassName Win32_Process
+  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (Get-CimInstance:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException


```

Environment data
----------------

I want to call WMI Commands such as this one:
Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Desktop -ComputerName  in linux but looks like this function is depreciated to  Get-CimInstance  but I am still having problems executing this command. 

```

```
